data_facts_with_vis_data.paragraph: Several powertrain configurations are available for the 2025 Model 3. The base Long Range RWD model has a single rear-mounted motor that produces 257 hp and 266 lb-ft of torque. In MotorTrend testing, this Model 3 accelerated to 60 mph in 5.6 seconds. Although it’s rated by the EPA at 363 miles of driving range, our real-world range testing of earlier versions of the Model 3 has yielded shorter-than-advertised results. However, the Model 3’s excellent efficiency will make it very cheap to fuel for those who can charge it at home.

facts.fact_content: The base Long Range RWD model produces 257 hp.
The base Long Range RWD model produces 266 lb-ft of torque.
The base Long Range RWD model accelerates to 60 mph in 5.6 seconds.
The base Long Range RWD model is rated by the EPA at 363 miles of driving range.

data_facts_with_vis_data.paragraph: The available Long Range AWD model has dual motors for electric all-wheel drive. Total output from these motors measures 394 hp and 377 lb-ft. With this power, the 0–60-mph time is reduced to 4.0 seconds. The Model 3 Long Range AWD is EPA-rated for 346 miles of range.

facts.fact_content: The Long Range AWD model produces 394 hp.
The Long Range AWD model produces 377 lb-ft of torque.
The Long Range AWD model accelerates to 60 mph in 4.0 seconds.
The Long Range AWD model is rated by the EPA at 346 miles of range.

data_facts_with_vis_data.paragraph: At a Tesla Supercharger, recharging the battery from 5 to 80 percent takes slightly more than 30 minutes. Although exclusive access to Superchargers has been a key perk for Tesla drivers, that privilege is lessening as the automaker opens its network to vehicles from other manufacturers.

facts.fact_content: Recharging the battery from 5 to 80 percent takes slightly more than 30 minutes at a Tesla Supercharger.

data_facts_with_vis_data.paragraph: To showcase the sporty potential of electric power, Tesla builds the Model 3 Performance. This dual-motor variant produces 510 hp and launches to 60 mph in a Tesla-claimed 2.9 seconds. Adaptive suspension, larger brakes, and aerodynamic body details further elevate the Performance’s performance. Inside, sport bucket seats are equipped, and within the touchscreen there are a variety of new settings, such as a Track model for driver-selectable motor torque split. Range falls to roughly 300 miles in EPA certification, potentially a worthwhile trade-off for the Model 3 Performance’s power.

facts.fact_content: The Model 3 Performance accelerates to 60 mph in 2.9 seconds.
The Model 3 Performance is rated by the EPA for roughly 300 miles of range.
